intro: Celmisia spectabilis subsp. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf celmisia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky areas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
